results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Search and Seizure;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Republican Party;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department
results.title: Republicans, Once Outraged by Mar-a-Lago Search, Become Quieter as Details Emerge
results.abstract: Some of former President Donald J. Trump’s most loyal allies were initially focused elsewhere — a potentially telling reaction with ramifications for his political future.

media.caption: From left, Eric Trump, Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, Tucker Carlson, Donald Trump Jr. and former President Donald J. Trump at his golf club in Bedminster, N.J., last month. The former president’s allies have been largely silent after the release of the affidavit.

results.adx_keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces;United States International Relations;Territorial Disputes;United States Navy;Taiwan;Taiwan Strait;China;United States
results.title: U.S. Warships Sail Taiwan Strait, Defying Chinese Pressure
results.abstract: Two guided-missile cruisers were the first to visit since China began extensive military drills after Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s visit to Taiwan.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: The guided-missile cruiser Antietam in the Taiwan Strait on Sunday, in a photo released by the U.S. Navy. China said that its own forces “remain on high alert.”

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Marriages;Love (Emotion);Dating and Relationships;Therapy and Rehabilitation;Psychology and Psychologists;Content Type: Personal Profile;Chapman, Gary (1938- )
results.byline: By Alisha Haridasani Gupta and Luis Mazon
results.title: The Sixth Love Language Does Not Exist
results.abstract: The author of the seminal book on love languages is surprised that the concept has become a cultural phenomenon. But he still wants couples to heed his advice.

media.caption: Karolyn and Gary Chapman at their wedding reception in August 1961. The couple, who have been married for over 60 years, said they had a rocky start.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Student Loans;Computers and the Internet;Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020);Social Media;Taxation;Republican Party;Twitter
results.title: White House Snaps Back at Twitter Critics of Student Loan Relief
results.abstract: In an aggressive turn, the normally staid @WhiteHouse account itemized hundreds of thousands of dollars in pandemic-related debt relief given to U.S. House members who criticized the Biden plan.
des_facet: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

media.caption: The White House Twitter account called out Republican members of Congress who tweeted criticism of President Biden’s student loan, noting that several had received government debt relief themselves.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.title: We Knew the Justice Department Case Was Righteous. This Affidavit Confirms It.
results.abstract: The government doesn’t get to pick and choose which documents to defend based on politics.

media.caption: Donald Trump at his golf course in Bedminster, N.J., in July.

results.adx_keywords: Therapy and Rehabilitation;Depression (Mental);Anxiety and Stress;Emotions;Teenagers and Adolescence;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Mental Health and Disorders;Psychology and Psychologists;Content Type: Service;Parenting;your-feed-health;American Academy of Pediatrics
results.title: ‘The Best Tool We Have’ for Self-Harming and Suicidal Teens
results.abstract: Studies indicate that dialectical behavior therapy offers greater benefits than more generalized therapy. But treatment is intensive, and expensive.

media.caption: “There’s no medication for suicidal behavior,” said Michele Berk, a psychologist at Stanford University. “The patient needs to learn other behavioral skills that the medication does not teach you.”
media.copyright: Anastasiia Sapon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Global Warming;Greenhouse Gas Emissions;Hazardous and Toxic Substances;PFAS (Per- and Polyfluoroalkyl Substances);Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Water Pollution;Environmental Protection Agency
results.title: E.P.A. to Designate PFAS, or ‘Forever Chemicals,’ as Hazardous
results.abstract: A proposed rule would require companies to report spills of two toxic chemicals that have been linked to cancer.

media.caption: PFAS chemicals have been found in a range of products including carpets, waterproof clothing and food packaging, including some microwave popcorn bags.

results.adx_keywords: Mental Health and Disorders;Teenagers and Adolescence;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Anxiety and Stress;Depression (Mental);Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder;Psychiatry and Psychiatrists
results.byline: By Matt Richtel and Annie Flanagan
results.title: This Teen Was Prescribed 10 Psychiatric Drugs. She’s Not Alone.
results.abstract: Increasingly, anxious and depressed teens are using multiple, powerful psychiatric drugs, many of them untested in adolescents or for use in tandem.

media.copyright: Annie Flanagan for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Governors;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Politics and Government;Mastriano, Doug;Army War College;Pennsylvania;Confederate States of America
results.title: Doug Mastriano Wore a Confederate Uniform in a Faculty Photo
results.abstract: Mr. Mastriano, the Republican nominee for governor of Pennsylvania, is a state senator whose district includes Gettysburg.

media.caption: Doug Mastriano, left, in a Confederate-style uniform in an Army War College photo from 2014. Mr. Mastriano is running for governor of Pennsylvania.

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Archives and Records;United States Politics and Government;Haines, Avril D;Trump, Donald J;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department
results.title: Intelligence Officials Will Assess Security Risks From Mar-a-Lago Documents
results.abstract: The director of national intelligence told lawmakers that her office would lead a review concerning the sensitive documents retrieved from former President Donald J. Trump’s Florida residence.

media.caption: Avril D. Haines, the director of national intelligence, said her office would work with the Justice Department to ensure that the assessment did not interfere with the department’s criminal investigation.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Midterm Elections (2022);Classified Information and State Secrets;Trump, Donald J;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Republican Party;Senate;House of Representatives
results.title: Republicans Signal Worries About Trump and the Midterms
results.abstract: Few Republicans appeared on the major Sunday talk shows to defend the former president. Those who did indicated that they would rather be talking about almost anything else.

media.caption: Senator Roy Blunt, Republican of Missouri, has questioned the timing of the F.B.I.’s search of former President Donald J. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Crossword Puzzles;Writing and Writers;Text Messaging;Language and Languages;Content Type: Service;Customs, Etiquette and Manners
results.title: No More Periods When Texting. Period.
results.abstract: To younger people, putting a period at the end of a casually written thought could mean that you’re raring for a fight.

media.caption: Do certain types of punctuation come off as rude in casual communication?
media.copyright: Max Harrison-Caldwell for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Palestinians;Arabs;Jews and Judaism;Social Media;Content Type: Personal Profile;International Relations;Discrimination;Yassin, Nuseir;Israel;Dubai (United Arab Emirates);United Arab Emirates
results.title: ‌A Social Media Star of a Changed Middle East: An Arab From Israel in Dubai
results.abstract: Nuseir Yassin, a Palestinian citizen of Israel with nearly 60 million followers, has taken advantage of new diplomatic ties to move to the United Arab Emirates — angering many Palestinians.

media.caption: Nuseir Yassin, a Palestinian born and raised in Israel, was one of the first Israeli passport holders to take advantage of new diplomatic relations between Israel and the United Arab Emirates.
media.copyright: Andrea DiCenzo for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Voting Machines;Computer Security;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Conspiracy Theories;Presidential Election of 2020;Willis, Fani T;Powell, Sidney (Attorney);Trump, Donald J;Dominion Voting Systems Corp;Coffee County (Ga);Fulton County (Ga);Georgia
results.byline: By Danny Hakim, Neil Vigdor and Richard Fausset
results.title: Election Data Breach Attracts Georgia Investigators
results.abstract: The district attorney in Atlanta is seeking to build a broad conspiracy case that encompasses multifaceted efforts by Trump allies to disrupt and overturn the 2020 election.

media.caption: Fani T. Willis, the district attorney in Fulton County, Ga., is conducting a wide-ranging investigation into meddling in the 2020 election.

results.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi, Raja Abdulrahim and Adam Entous
results.title: Fighting Between U.S. and Iran-Backed Militias Escalates in Syria
results.abstract: Two strikes on U.S. military sites have been tied to forces aligned with Iran, raising tensions just as Washington appears close to striking a new nuclear deal with Tehran.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: American forces patrolling in Syria’s northeastern Hasakeh Province in May.

results.adx_keywords: Moon;Artemis Program;Space and Astronomy;Rocket Science and Propulsion;National Aeronautics and Space Administration
results.title: How and When to Watch NASA’s Giant Rocket Launch to the Moon
results.abstract: Here’s what you need to know about Artemis I and the launch of the Space Launch System and Orion capsule.

media.caption: The Space Launch System and Orion capsule on Friday. The rocket is scheduled to lift off for the uncrewed Artemis I mission on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);School Boards;School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Parkland, Fla, Shooting (2018);DeSantis, Ron;Broward County (Fla);Florida
results.title: DeSantis Suspends 4 Elected School Board Members After Report on Parkland
results.abstract: A grand jury report found the board members had engaged in “acts of incompetence and neglect of duty,” but an ousted member called the governor’s move “political retribution.”

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis’s decision to suspend four Broward County school board members was not unexpected because of a grand jury recommendation.
media.copyright: Luis Santana/Tampa Bay Times, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Search and Seizure;Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Cannon, Aileen M;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department
results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Judge Signals Intent to Appoint Special Master in Mar-a-Lago Search
results.abstract: The judge, an appointee of President Donald J. Trump, indicated she was prepared to grant Mr. Trump’s request for an arbiter, or special master, to review the documents seized by the F.B.I.

media.caption: Judge Aileen M. Cannon set a hearing for arguments in the matter for Thursday in the federal courthouse in West Palm Beach, Fla.

results.title: What’s With All the Fluff About a New Civil War, Anyway?
results.abstract: Why the idea of two new separate “blue” and “red” countries is absurd.

results.adx_keywords: Islands;Roads and Traffic;Floods;Rescues;Automobiles;Maritime Accidents and Safety;Travel and Vacations;Christians and Christianity;Palaces and Castles;Holy Island (England)
results.byline: By Stephen Castle and Andrew Testa
results.title: A Holy British Island, Where the Reckless Try to Outrace the Tide
results.abstract: As the cradle of Christianity in northern England, the isle of Lindisfarne attracts 650,000 visitors a year, some of whom ignore the warning signs of when it’s safe to cross a causeway that twice a day is submerged.

media.caption: High tide beginning to cover the causeway to Holy Island.
media.copyright: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
